channel.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
channel.description:
Alright, I USED to run my own server, worked fine. Couple months later im trying it again, I can connect through localhost (duh)... I was wondering whats wrong, so here ya go!
[b]Download JDK[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/omfg.jpg[/img]
[b] I got my IP address and here is my no-ip:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp3-1.jpg[/img]
[b]No-ip DUC:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp2.jpg[/img]
[b]To PortForwarding:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/omfg-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/routerpf-1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/last1.jpg[/img]
[b]Running the Server:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/desertpk.jpg[/img]
[b]Results:[/b] [IMG]http://i325.photobucket.com/albums/k374/stevextuck/rshelp6.jpg[/img]
Anyone know what the dealio is? :\

item.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
item.dc:creator: @steveolicious steveolicious
item.description:
@steveolicious wrote:

As in 192.168.1.1? Yeah
as in .101 or my real ip? No

Read full topic

item.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“steveolicious, post:6, topic:222730”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=292545.msg2356046#msg2356046 date=1217304766]
go to router [192.168.1.1] -> Security -> Tick off Block WAN Requests, if it isn’t checked, leave it. It’s also called Block Anonymous Internet Requests (if you look to the left it says Block WAN Requests as well…

When checked the router blocks any and all requests regardless if you port forwarded or not.

also: it’s ok if you leave the router’s firewall on, just make sure block wan requests is off.
[/quote]
Which shows the firewall disabled and that box un-checked if you looked :).[/quote]
Oh sorry, didn’t notice that picture, only the port forwarding screen.
If you go to your direct ip in your browser, does the router login appear?

Read full topic

item.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
item.dc:creator: @steveolicious steveolicious
item.description:
@steveolicious wrote:

[quote=“Hidendra, post:5, topic:222730”]go to router [192.168.1.1] -> Security -> Tick off Block WAN Requests, if it isn’t checked, leave it. It’s also called Block Anonymous Internet Requests (if you look to the left it says Block WAN Requests as well…

When checked the router blocks any and all requests regardless if you port forwarded or not.

also: it’s ok if you leave the router’s firewall on, just make sure block wan requests is off.[/quote]
Which shows the firewall disabled and that box un-checked if you looked :).

Read full topic

item.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

go to router [192.168.1.1] -> Security -> Tick off Block WAN Requests, if it isn’t checked, leave it. It’s also called Block Anonymous Internet Requests (if you look to the left it says Block WAN Requests as well…

When checked the router blocks any and all requests regardless if you port forwarded or not.

also: it’s ok if you leave the router’s firewall on, just make sure block wan requests is off.

Read full topic

item.title: [Detailed] Connection Problem
item.dc:creator: @steveolicious steveolicious
item.description:
@steveolicious wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:3, topic:222730”]On your portforwarding, Change ‘both’ to TCP Only.

Also try turning your firewall off.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 28, 2008, 09:58:15 pm[/size][hr][quote author=sp4rkz link=topic=292545.msg2356019#msg2356019 date=1217303843]
Do you like to give out your ip :|?
[/quote]

sparks Why’d you block me on msn.

My name is Jamie.[/quote]
Did not work. (the both>tcp)
Windows firewall is off, along with router and McAfee Firewall

Read full topic
